p: Clearly this issue was on the radar of the WHO before Indonesia made its move in 2007, only it was not yet labelled viral sovereignty. Furthermore, upon her appointment as Director General of the WHO in 2006, Margaret Chan was asked about the issue of China not sharing influenza samples with the WHO. 27 Chan responded, “I will definitely speak out and urge China to share specimens and information”. 28 China resumed sharing viruses with the WHO (via the United States’ Center for Disease Control and Prevention) shortly thereafter. 29
